main event: A fireball was sighted at approximately 1358 hours on 24 February 1950, in Albuquerque, New Mexico by multiple witnesses.
interesting points: The object was reported to cross a field of a theodolite, indicating it was observed with careful measurement,It was described as having a color similar to the moon during the daytime,Two experienced weather observers were involved in the sighting,Details regarding the object's elevation and direction were meticulously documented,The case was ultimately closed after all logical leads were exhausted.
